text:
Q: What's the net::ERR_HTTP2_PROTOCOL_ERROR about? A:

My access token was too large, making the header also too large, so I refactored its content

Q: How can I delete from a text file, all lines that contain a specific string? A:

To remove the line and print the output to standard out:

sed '/pattern to match/d' ./infile

To directly modify the file (it does not work with BSD sed):

sed -i '/pattern to match/d' ./infile

The same, but for BSD sed (Mac OS X and FreeBSD. It does not work with GNU sed):

sed -i '' '/pattern to match/d' ./infile

To directly modify the file (and create a backup. It works with BSD and GNU sed):

sed -i.bak '/pattern to match/d' ./infile

Q: Python subprocess failed with "is not recognized as an internal or external command" A:

I created a test application named hello.exe and placed it in C:\cygwin64\home\charl\cygwin64

This test app just prints "Hello World" to the console.

I think that your problem is the way you specified the new PATH in the export line. You need to use windows format.

Change export PATH=$PATH:/home/joe/ltx/bin to export PATH="$PATH:C:\cygwin64\home\joe\ltx\bin"

Opening the cygwin64 terminal I got the following results.

charl@R16 ~
$ export PATH="$PATH:C:\cygwin64\home\charl\cygwin64"
charl@R16 ~
$ hello
Hello World
charl@R16 ~
$ python
Python 3.12.7 | packaged by Anaconda, Inc. | (main, Oct  4 2024, 13:17:27) [MSC v.1929 64 bit (AMD64)] on win32
Type "help", "copyright", "credits" or "license" for more information.
\>>> import subprocess
\>>> subprocess.run("hello")
Hello World
CompletedProcess(args='hello', returncode=0)

I have updated with below

  1. I added the suggested PATH
export PATH=$PATH:/home/joe/mos
export PATH="$PATH:C:\cygwin64\home\ephiiam\ltng\bin"  --> added
  1. check the new PATH
[~]$ echo $PATH
C:\cygwin64\home\joe\ltx\bin
  1. Try the subprocess again

-call the application

[~]$ ltx -h
[INFO] Startup arguments: [-h]      -->working

-Try subprocess --> still failed

[~]$ python
Python 3.12.2 (tags/v3.12.2:6abddd9, Feb  6 2024, 21:26:36) [MSC v.1937 64 bit (AMD64)] on win32
Type "help", "copyright", "credits" or "license" for more information.
\>>> import subprocess
\>>> subprocess.run(['ltx','-h'], shell=True)
'ltx' is not recognized as an internal or external command,
operable program or batch file.
CompletedProcess(args=['ltx', '-h'], returncode=1)

**Updated

[~]$ export PATH="$PATH:C:\cygwin64\home\joe\ltx\bin"
[~]$ ltx -h
[INFO] Startup arguments: [-h]
NAME
...
  
[~]$ python
Python 3.12.2 (tags/v3.12.2:6abddd9, Feb  6 2024, 21:26:36) [MSC v.1937 64 bit (AMD64)] on win32
Type "help", "copyright", "credits" or "license" for more information.
>>> import subprocess
>>> subprocess.run(['ltx','-h'],shell=True)
'ltx' is not recognized as an internal or external command,
operable program or batch file.
CompletedProcess(args=['ltx', '-h'], returncode=1)
>>>
